Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_n9t3u7QCEh1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><a href="http://bit.ly/1o8Ao1g"><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/9c3cbdf759ea9208bba896f677fc5ade/tumblr_inline_n9t41xAMxL1rr2wit.png"/></a></p>

<p><strong>RoverDude</strong> describes <a href="http://bit.ly/1o8Ao1g"><strong>KARBONITE</strong></a> as “<em>A newly discovered mineral that has hydrocarbon-like properties and is perfect for processing into a fuel.</em>" It’s much more than that, though.</p>

<p><strong>Karbonite</strong> aims to encourage a new level of community-driven creations and direction for a single mod. With community-based licensing and an even friendlier framework, you, yes you have the opportunity to involved yourself with <strong>Karbonite</strong> in a very deep way.</p>

<p>Speaking of deep, <strong>Karbonit</strong>e already has a fairly deep list of what’s included, what’s coming up, what it’s compatible with and what you can do to further the development. Read the full list <a href="http://bit.ly/1o8Ao1g"><strong>HERE</strong></a>.</p>

Great mod that I have been keeping updated in my ksp install since the first dev release!

I am excited to watch it develop!(at breakneck speeds!!)
I've been waiting for the release of this to give it a try. I'm going to be busy tonight.
This seems really cool! Maybe even cool enough to tempt me to install my first not-just-visual mod...

This seems really cool! Maybe even cool enough to tempt me to install my first not-just-visual mod...

It is indeed really cool. I also highly recommend taking a look at his MKS/OKS mod. With the two of them it basically becomes: Harvest Resources -> Process Resources -> Return Resources to Kerbin for $$$

It gives a nice alternative way to make money late game than contracts.
Cant praise Karbonite enough. It makes setting up self sustaining colonies a reality in a more user friendly way than Kethane!
Brilliant creativity here. I shall have to make cloud city on jool w/ HL
